claims.statement: Valproic acid modulates VDAC1 indirectly — it alters VDAC expression and oligomerization state via effects on cardiolipin and ceramide metabolism — but no direct high-affinity binding (Kd < 50 µM) has been demonstrated.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Specifies bilayer electrophysiology test showing no direct modulation at <100 µM as disproof.
claims.feasible_reason: Planar bilayer electrophysiology with purified VDAC is a standard method in mitochondrial ion channel research.
claims.novel_reason: Enables quantitative distinction between direct binding and indirect lipid-mediated effects in VPA-VDAC context.

claims.statement: NAPQI interacts with VDAC1 via covalent modification of exposed cysteine residue(s) (Cys127, Cys232), contributing to mitochondrial permeability transition during acetaminophen toxicity.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Mass spectrometry failing to detect NAPQI adducts on specific VDAC cysteines disproves it.
claims.feasible_reason: LC-MS/MS on isolated mitochondria from treated cells is routine proteomics.
claims.novel_reason: Links specific covalent sites to APAP toxicity cascade, enabling targeted mutant validation.

claims.statement: Metformin at mitochondrial matrix concentrations (estimated 1–10 mM due to membrane-potential-driven accumulation) likely modulates VDAC gating from the intermembrane space side, but published direct binding data are absent.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Planar bilayer recordings showing no gating effect up to 10 mM disproves direct modulation.
claims.feasible_reason: Bilayer electrophysiology with concentration titration is standard for VDAC.
claims.novel_reason: Tests charge-sensitive gating hypothesis at accumulated concentrations, advancing metformin-VDAC synthesis.

claims.statement: Lipophilic statins (atorvastatin, simvastatin; logP >4) partition into the outer mitochondrial membrane at sufficient concentrations to alter VDAC-lipid interactions and gating, representing a plausible contributor to statin myopathy.
claims.falsifiable_reason: No conductance change in atorvastatin-doped membranes at therapeutic levels disproves it.
claims.feasible_reason: Reconstituted VDAC in doped liposomes with electrophysiology is feasible.
claims.novel_reason: Quantifies statin membrane partitioning as myopathy variable, testable against lipophilicity predictions.

claims.statement: A systematic VDAC interaction landscape for the top 20 mitochondrially-active drugs does not currently exist in published literature; predicted occupancy ranking would place lipophilic weak acids/bases with membrane-partitioning coefficients >100 as highest-risk.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Finding a published systematic screen for ≥10 drugs disproves the literature gap.
claims.feasible_reason: Literature search and meta-analysis of existing screens is straightforward.
claims.novel_reason: Identifies key gap for high-throughput VDAC screen of top mito-drugs, enabling landscape mapping.

claims.statement: Valproic acid (VPA) engages VDAC1 at therapeutically relevant concentrations (Cmax ~500–700 µM).
claims.falsifiable_reason: VDAC1 knockout abolishing VPA depolarization/swelling disproves engagement at Cmax.
claims.feasible_reason: CRISPR KO in hepatocytes with mito imaging is standard.
claims.novel_reason: Ties therapeutic VPA levels to VDAC Ca²⁺ flux like CBD, falsifiable in cells.

claims.statement: NAPQI (acetaminophen metabolite) covalently modifies VDAC1 cysteines, contributing to mitochondrial permeability transition (MPT) pore opening.
claims.falsifiable_reason: MS failing to detect adducts or cysteine mutants resisting toxicity disproves it.
claims.feasible_reason: MS and mutant expression in cells are routine.
claims.novel_reason: Specifies Cys sites in MPT, enabling site-directed validation in APAP model.

claims.statement: Metformin does not directly modulate VDAC gating but may indirectly alter VDAC conductance via Complex I inhibition and Δψm collapse.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Direct binding detected by SPR/MST at <1 mM disproves no-direct-modulation claim.
claims.feasible_reason: SPR or MST for protein-ligand Kd is standard biophysical assay.
claims.novel_reason: Distinguishes indirect Δψm from direct effects, refining metformin hypothesis.

claims.statement: Lipophilic statins (e.g., atorvastatin) occupy VDAC1 at concentrations linked to myopathy (Cmax ~0.1–1 µM), competing with cholesterol for membrane microdomains.
claims.falsifiable_reason: No conductance change at 1 µM in liposome reconstitution disproves it.
claims.feasible_reason: VDAC reconstitution and patch-clamp is feasible.
claims.novel_reason: Proposes pore intercalation mechanism testable at myopathy concentrations.

claims.statement: The top 20 mitochondrial-acting drugs’ VDAC interaction likelihood correlates with logP > 3 and pKa < 7.4 (anionic at cytosolic pH).
claims.falsifiable_reason: Screen showing no logP/pKa correlation with affinity disproves it.
claims.feasible_reason: QSAR-guided binding screen (e.g., MST) of 20 drugs is doable.
claims.novel_reason: Provides predictive model for VDAC-drug prioritization across top mito-drugs.

claims.statement: Valproic acid (VPA) modulates VDAC1 oligomerization and conductance at therapeutic concentrations (~50μM free).
claims.falsifiable_reason: Patch-clamp showing no effect at 10-100 µM disproves modulation.
claims.feasible_reason: Electrophysiology on purified VDAC is standard.
claims.novel_reason: Specifies N-helix binding at free therapeutic levels, linking to oligomerization.

claims.statement: NAPQI covalently modifies VDAC1 cysteines in toxicity cascade, potentiating MPT at supratherapeutic acetaminophen doses (>150μg/mL).
claims.falsifiable_reason: LC-MS lacking adducts in exposed mito disproves covalent modification.
claims.feasible_reason: Proteomics on treated mitochondria is routine.
claims.novel_reason: Connects arylation to ROS/MPT amplification at supratherapeutic doses.

claims.statement: Lipophilic statins (atorvastatin) occupy VDAC1 at muscle mito concentrations (~1-10μM), contributing to myopathy.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Docking score worse than CBD disproves occupancy.
claims.feasible_reason: AutoDock on PDB:3EMN is standard computational screen.
claims.novel_reason: Ranks atorvastatin vs. CBD benchmark, guiding experimental follow-up.

claims.statement: Among top 20 mito drugs (metformin, atorva, aspirin, omeprazole), predicted VDAC1 interactors at C_eff/TI: VPA >>> aspirin > simvastatin > naproxen; metformin/levothyroxine negligible.
claims.falsifiable_reason: CETSA showing no thermal shift for top candidates disproves prediction.
claims.feasible_reason: CETSA for VDAC stability is established biophysical method.
claims.novel_reason: QSAR-based ranking enables prioritized testing of top 20 mito-drugs.

claims.statement: Valproic acid (VPA) directly modulates VDAC1, promoting an open state that contributes to its mitochondrial toxicity.
claims.falsifiable_reason: No change in open probability/conductance at 500 µM in bilayer disproves it.
claims.feasible_reason: Reconstituted bilayer assays are standard for VDAC gating.
claims.novel_reason: Predicts open-state stabilization at high Cmax, contrasting closed-state modulators.

claims.statement: The reactive acetaminophen metabolite, NAPQI, covalently modifies VDAC1, contributing to the mitochondrial permeability transition and subsequent cell death in overdose.
claims.falsifiable_reason: MS failing to identify adducts while hitting other targets disproves it.
claims.feasible_reason: MS on hepatocyte mito fractions is feasible.
claims.novel_reason: Positions NAPQI-VDAC in MPT sensitization pathway.

claims.statement: Lipophilic statins (e.g., atorvastatin) are low-affinity VDAC modulators, and their accumulation in the outer mitochondrial membrane is a key initiating factor in statin-associated myopathy.
claims.falsifiable_reason: VDAC1 KO mice resistant despite statin accumulation disproves it.
claims.feasible_reason: Muscle-specific VDAC1 KO mice require novel engineering beyond standard labs.
claims.novel_reason: Allosteric constraint hypothesis advances myopathy mechanism if feasible.

claims.statement: Valproic acid and its reactive metabolites likely engage VDAC1, contributing to its hepatotoxicity, given its known induction of mitochondrial permeability transition.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Unchanged toxicity in VDAC KO or no binding <100 µM disproves it.
claims.feasible_reason: KO cells and binding assays (e.g., MST) are standard.
claims.novel_reason: Implicates VPA metabolites in Cys modification like NAPQI claims.

claims.statement: Acetaminophen toxicity (NAPQI) does not primarily involve direct VDAC modulation; its mitochondrial dysfunction is downstream of JNK activation and MPT pore opening.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Direct NAPQI inhibition of VDAC before JNK in isolated mito disproves it.
claims.feasible_reason: Isolated mito electrophysiology with inhibitors is feasible.
claims.novel_reason: Contrasts direct vs. JNK-downstream models, resolvable experimentally.

claims.statement: Lipophilic statins (atorvastatin, simvastatin) at high myopathic concentrations partition into the mitochondrial outer membrane and non-specifically disrupt VDAC oligomerization, contributing to myopathy.
claims.falsifiable_reason: No change in conductance/oligomer at micro vs. nanomolar statin disproves it.
claims.feasible_reason: Muscle mito exposure with electrophysiology/Western is standard.
claims.novel_reason: Quantifies dose-dependent disruption of HK-II coupling in myopathy.

recommendation: Lab Gate PASSED with filter. 19/20 claims cleared. 1 filtered: 'Lipophilic statins (e.g., atorvastatin) are low-af...' not feasible
